title: What to Watch: Four New Releases to Stream This Week
sub_head: Elton John recommends ‘It’s a Sin’ on HBO Max and the award-contender ‘Nomadland’ comes to Hulu and more picks to add to your queue
body:
It’s winter and it’s award season. There are few better times to catch up on what you’ve missed, what’s new and the recent performances generating critical buzz. See a recent profile of Daniel Kaluuya, an actor whose profile has risen through a string of noteworthy films, including “Judas and the Black Messiah” (now streaming on HBO Max).
Here’s what is streaming this week:
(HBO Max)
Aside from being a world-famous musician, Sir Elton John has devoted much of his advocacy work to the Elton John AIDS Foundation, which he founded in 1992. Here, he recommends ‘It’s a Sin,” a limited series that chronicles the early days of the epidemic in the U.K. All five episodes begin streaming Thursday on HBO Max. Edited from an interview.
“Russell T Davies, who has written so many wonderful things—from ‘Queer as Folk’ to ‘Doctor Who’—has written a new series called ‘It’s a Sin’ that’s set among a group of gay men in the early ‘80s and the start of the AIDS epidemic in Britain. I was wondering how they were going to do it and they did it more than brilliantly. It was so accurate. It was so moving.
